definition: to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: You feel choked to stay dawn these deadpans.
sentences.chinese: 和那些面无表情的人在一起任务真让人憋气。

sentences.english: This requires tremendous discipline and breath control.
sentences.chinese: 这项练习对耐力和憋气的要求极为大。

sentences.english: The mind also becomes tranquil by alternately expelling and retaining the breath.
sentences.chinese: 呼气和憋气交互进行，头脑也可以变平静。

sentences.english: Do not hold your breath if you have high blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有高血压请勿憋气。

sentences.english: You feel choked to work with those deadpans.
sentences.chinese: 和那些面无神色的人在一路工作真让人憋气。

sentences.english: That will be most exasperating and discouraging.
sentences.chinese: 这是最让人丧气和憋气的地方。

sentences.english: I feel choked to work with those deadpans.
sentences.chinese: 和那些面无表情的人一起工作真让人憋气。

sentences.english: How long can you hold your breath?
Abdomen drawing as far as possible, but keeping carrying on eupnea, doing not feel suffocated.
sentences.chinese: 将腹部尽量吸进，但要继续进行正常呼吸，不要憋气。

definition: to feel oppressed/to be depressed/to feel dejected
to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to kick one's legs/leg press (exercise)/(coll.) to kick the bucket
to take a breath (in swimming)/to ventilate
to choke/to stifle/to restrain/to hold back/to hold in (urine)/to hold (one's breath)
